Job Responsibilities:

Job Cost

  • Ensure timely and accurate batching and capturing of project cost.
  • Ensure timely and accurate preparation of monthly job cost statement.
  • Ensure timely payments of trade creditors.
  • Ensure timely reconciliation of inter-company/ major credits and resolution of disputes.
  • Ensure timely and accurate capture of project budgeted revenue and cost into JDE system.
  • Ensure Job Cost Module is closed on time.
  • Liaise with Procurement Department and Contracts Department for timely creation of new project cost code.
  • Assist superior in the preparation of job cost analysis reports.

Project Accounting

  • Prepare relevant Project Accounting reports for management and project operation needs.
  • Monthly reporting of project accrual and turnover.
  • Monitor purchase order issued are within the authorized limit.
  • Ensure all debit notes are accounted for.
  • Ensure timely distribution of Project Cost Statements and any relevant project reports to Project Manager.
  • Brief superior on project’s monthly financial performance.

Accounts Payable

  • Monitor the coordination with purchasers on over-supply and price different of materials and services render from vendors.
  • Coordinate with various departments on the Accounts Payable inputs and payments.
  • Coordinate on the closing of monthly Accounts Payable.

Accounts Receivable

  • Liaise with Project Manager and Contracts Department on submission of client progress claims

certified claims and payments.
  • Ensure submission of client certified claim to Shared Service Centre.
  • Liaise with Contracts Department (at project site) on monthly turnover.

column1: Report to Head of Construction as line manager;
Report to Construction Manager on project level;
Maintain and regular update on the construction schedule and inform to CM;
Collect the schedule from all contractors and combine into master schedule;
Manage and track the master schedule into the detailed level that can be tracked;
Ensure the resources deployment included in the schedule;
Advise the actual resource productivity of Contractor based on performed and actual schedule to the Construction Manager;
Prepare daily monitoring and three week a head monitoring schedule for Discipline Supervisor and Site Engineer;
Report and investigate any deviation in the master schedule compare to the Client project milestone and assist CM to prepare mitigation plan;
Advise CM for any schedule deviation or foreseen deviation in the future;
Verify actual works progress at the site and advise CM on the deviation;
Prepare draft of monthly report for CM regarding schedule and progress.
You will be based in {location}ota Damansara

column1: What You Will Do As Site Planner/Expeditor

• Report to Head of Construction as line manager;
  • Report to Construction Manager on project level;
  • Maintain and regular update on the construction schedule and inform to CM;
  • Collect the schedule from all contractors and combine into master schedule;
  • Manage and track the master schedule into the detailed level that can be tracked;
  • Ensure the resources deployment included in the schedule;
  • Advise the actual resource productivity of Contractor based on performed and actual schedule to the Construction Manager;
  • Prepare daily monitoring and three week a head monitoring schedule for Discipline Supervisor and Site Engineer;
  • Attend weekly coordination meeting;
  • Report and investigate any deviation in the master schedule compare to the Client project milestone and assist CM to prepare mitigation plan;
  • Advise CM for any schedule deviation or foreseen deviation in the future;
  • Verify actual works progress at the site and advise CM on the deviation;
  • Prepare draft of monthly report for CM regarding schedule and progress.
You will be based in Kota Damansara
Kindly apply by clicking the button below with your updated CV.
Acquisition by agencies is not appreciated.

More than 3 years experience in construction industry for building services.
Willing to work across Malaysia at project site throughout project duration.
Experienced in building services such as Fire Protection

column9: Solar Systems|"Job Description for Electrical Engineer –

column1: Solar PV System Grid-Connected Photovoltaic (GCPV) certified

column2: design and delivery of grid connected solar photovoltaic systems (including commercial and industrial rooftops and utility scale) on time and on budget.

column1: 2) Manage proposals and the bid/award process for obtaining these services and will provide
project management and design consultation for all projects.
3) He/She will review solar system engineering designs
provide engineering support during the construction process.
4) Core Responsibilities Conduct engineering site audits to collect structural
column2: electrical and related site information for use in the design of commercial and utility-scale solar power systems

column1: 5) Design and coordinate design of photovoltaic (PV) systems
column2: including system components and generation of BOQ/BOM to suit site condition and in accordance to solar engineering standards (MS

column1: 6) Design and develop electrical single-line diagram
column2: panel schedules and connection diagram for solar electric systems using computer-aided design (CAD) software

column1: 7) Complete all electrical calculations in detail related to the project (DC and AC)
8) Prepare PV system report and PR calculations
9) Perform solar energy production analysis from designed PV systems and seek to optimize
10) Review specifications and recommend engineering or manufacturing changes to achieve solar design objectives
11) Evaluate plans or specifications to determine technological or environmental implications
12) Recommend technical design or process changes to improve efficiency
13) Provide technical direction or support to Project Manager and Engineer during installation
14) Create checklists for review or inspection of completed solar installation projects
15) Analyze costs and benefits of proposed designs or projects and performing cost reduction
16) Review of EPC's Scope of Work
column2: Specifications and comments on design and installation

column1: 17) Attend site visits during construction for review and inspection of installation works of solar
18) Qualification Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or equivalent
20) At least 3 years of relevant working experience in PV system design and engineering and low
column2: medium and high voltage power electronics.

column1: 22) Working knowledge of standard electrical calculations

column1: Manage the development of the risk appetite

column2: refine and review of Risk Register and evaluate the relevance of risks identified across business units in the Group.

column1: Documenting and maintaining risk register and relevant Risk Management documents.

particularly preparation of Risk Management Report to the Management Board.

column1: Identify and implement initiatives including stakeholders’ engagements

and project support.
  • Your scope will be global for our Architectural Coatings
column5:
Industrial Coatings and other business units according to our S/4 roadmap.

column2: Computer Science or other business-related field is required.

column1: Consistent record of at least 6 years' proven ability
column2: with strong end to end process knowledge and of in all SAP FICO modules/functions (AA
column8: CO and CO-PC processes); as well as general SAP ECC knowledge. Prior participation in support and/or project implementation as team member.

column1: Superb communication (oral and written English) and social skills. Have experience working in an international/virtual/geographically distributed team and ability to collaborate
column2: work independently and work efficiently in a “remote working” organization without close supervision

column1: An outstanding self-starter with a commitment to delivering high quality work in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
Broad analytical and technical skills to isolate problems
column4: and implement complete solutions. Highly curious with strong desire to discover new findings and flexible in a problem-solving environment

column1:
• Good functional end-to-end SD / MM /PP process integration with SAP FICO processes.
  • Extensive experience in the process design
column3: support and trouble-shooting of SAP FICO modules

column1: Preferred Requirements With Knowledge Or Experience With The Following

• SAP S/4 HANA and/or connections to SAP cloud solutions (e.g. Concur).
  • Related working experience in SAP support environment and/or SAP project implementation in the areas of Finance.
  • Experience using SAP Solution Manager toolset for managing changes
